availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Josiah Marshall (Shelby County, KY, lumber mill owner)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, lumber mill owner. Maryland native. Married to Margaret Marshall. Married to Sarah B. Marshall. Father of Ann E. Marshall, James W. Marshall, Elizabeth Marshall, Helen A. Marshall, Mary E. Marshall, Maggie V. Marshall, John W. Marshall, and Nannie B. Marshall. Owned five enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1850. Farmer in Spencer County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved people in Shelby County in 1860. Lumber mill owner in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, p. 75A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, City/District, p. 160
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, p. 4
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 253B
